intro: Gonolobus pseudobarbatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically features heart-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface and produces vibrant blue or purple flowers that bloom in the morning. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its rapid growth and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a garden plant.
